Tanya we will now take a look at a basic monetization models in Ott streams so
one of the most common ways to monetize Ott streams is subscription based and then transaction based so subscription
based is a model where user typically pays for a service which is usually
monthly annual quarterly or biannual the subscription model either provides
access to all the contents or a list of channels depending upon the plans covered by the content provider for
example users who are interested in sports would essentially purchase a sports pack which will stream all these
Sports channel to the end users and similarly similar way if they are interested in kids pack they would be
provided with all the kids channels which would contain you know animated videos and stuff like that and
transaction based model is a model where users pay to access a single piece of content or stream the charges can
involve a rental fee or a pay-per-view for a live live content since you own the content in both the models you can
play this across multiple devices or platforms the major disadvantage with these models where the revenue is
directly proportional to the popularity which would only come when the subscriber base would increase as a
result the platform and the content providers started started introducing advertisements to earn revenue from
these streams and with monetization or ad insertion would help the content
providers monetize their streams so if we talk about evolution of Ott advertising it can be classified into
three parts it started with burnt in static advertisements then it transpired
into client-side advertising insertion and finally it resulted in service added
insertion so burnt in advertisements basically is a process where all the end
users would be presented with the same advertisement to all the users it would mean that there would be no
personalization at all it then transpired into client-side ad insertion because there was a need for
some kind of personalization so in client-side ad insertion the advertisements would be inserted into
the Ott streams but the logic would be completely reliant on the client that
the people were using the server-side ad insertion model would introduce advertisements at the origin
level itself so with server-side insertion the advertisements are inserted in the origin stream thereby
matching the Renditions and other video artifacts we will cover server side ad insertion in the upcoming slides to
explain how server side insertion fixes the issue which we see in client-side and burnt in static ions
so let us now take a look at some disadvantages of burnt in static advertisements
all the users would be presented with the same advertisements so users would typically switch to another Channel or
content during an ad break as it was not relevant to them as a result the content owners were not able to provide
important ad break slots to relevant advertisers which resulted in Revenue loss this led to an innovation and the
advertisements in the Stream began to be inserted on the client side to increase some personalization aspect so with
client side and AD insertion the personalization did did get introduced
but there were a lot of issues with it let us now take a look at some of the disadvantages or some of the drawbacks
of client-side AD insertion because drawback was users could skip the advertisements from being played by
using a tool or a software called an ad blocker this was a huge Revenue loss as
the monetization in ad insertion is based on Impressions sent by the player
if the advertisements are not played Impressions would not be sent out which would cause Revenue loss apart from this
with client-side ad insertion the entire logic was left on user devices
so there was a need to maintain and build code for multiple platforms and players which required a lot of efforts
as the user base was typically spread across multiple devices ranging from say Android phones to you know devices like
Xbox or PlayStations it was a huge effort to maintain code for different
type of devices and another issue which was a major one was at fill ratio on
desktops and web players was too low because it was very easy to install ad
blocker softwares on these systems and another issue was quality of advertisements in the client-side ad
insertion would not every time match the quality of the content streamed by the origin as a result the end users would
see a bad quality video as compared to your original content stream this
contributed to bad viewership experience for the users all in all the client-side ad insertion did increase
personalization but came with a lot of disadvantages as a result the next step of evolution
happened which was server-side ad insertion so let us now talk about some benefits
of server-side iron insertion the first most improved quality of experience for
the end users the advertisement quality would match the content quality thereby
improving the viewership experience for the end users second was the advertisements were stitched in the
original content Stream So it became difficult or next to impossible for ad blockers to identify the advertisement
segments and hence they would not be blocked this resulted in increased Revenue as The Impressions were sent by
the players which would also increase the third benefit was improved or increased personalization per user the
client-side parameters would be sent to an ad decision server by the server-side ad insertion which would then respond
with relevant advertisements for the user based on their preferences as a
result in a single stream one user might be watching says advertisements related
to sports where the other user might be presented with advertisements related to entertainment because the use user
preferences were sent to the art decision server since the personalization aspect was introduced
the viewership also increased and the viewers would not switch streams or channels during an ad break because the
advertisements which were presented to them were relevant and fourth was monetization with all of the benefits
that we just discussed the content owners were able to monetize their video streams more effectively as no ad breaks
were skipped because of increased personalization the end users would not know if an advertisement segment is
being played out at all with server-side ad insertion having talked about different models of

piece sure so add fill rate basically is a ratio of the actual ad duration versus
the number of advertisements that were filled in the ad at break for example if your ad break was say 60 seconds long
add fill ratio would do a 60 divided by number of advertisements filled and the
higher the add fill rate the higher is the opportunity to monetize so all the server-side ident services would aim to
ensure that the add fill ratio remains as high as possible to increase monetization
